en.sc1: What is the cost of Bubblesort?
en.sc2: The number of comparisons made by the inner for loop on the $i^{th}$ iteration is always $n-i$.
en.sc3: Consider the following example of an array with 6 elements:
en.sc4: At $i=0$ we have 5 comparisons. Let's mark this with 5 boxes.
en.sc9: At $i=1$ we have 4 comparisons, so 4 boxes.
en.sc13: At $i=2$ we have 3 comparisons, so 3 boxes.
en.sc17: At $i=3$ we have 2 comparisons, so 2 boxes.
en.sc20: At $i=4$ we have only 1 comparison, so 1 box.
en.sc21: The total amount of comparisons will be the surface area of this shape.
en.sc22: The total area will be the sum of the areas of the big triangle $+$ the series of ($n-1$) small traingles.
en.sc24: Therefore, the worst case running time of Bubble sort is $\theta(n^2).$
